text:
I have developed an enhancement to mod_ssl that exposes 2 functions.

The first returns whether SSL is in use, the second returns the encryption 
level being used (128 bit etc).  I have never submitted to open source before 
and wondered if these sort of enhancements would be likely to be accepted 
before I go to the effort of creating patch's etc.

Thanks for the good work
Mick
creator: mick@mickandwendy.com
mads@apache.org
text:
These should already be handled by environment variables:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_ssl.html#envvars
specifically HTTPS and SSL_CIPHER_USEKEYSIZE

I'm setting this bug to wontfix because I believe that there is nothing to
enhance, but please feel free to change it if your patch does in fact do
something else.

thanks for using Apache.

I know that if you have the env vars switch on then you can use them.  The 
problem I had was the manual I referenced (the definitive guide) it said that 
enabling these was a performance hit.  The project I was working on was a very 
busy web site (Millions of hits per day) and I could not risk any performance 
problems.  This fix provides a performant way of accessing this information.

Mick
creator: mick@mickandwendy.com

text:
From a module you can use the ssl_var_lookup hook directly without needing to
enable +StdEnvVars, though that won't necessarily do what you want.  Another
hook to expose access to the SSL * would probably be a useful feature. 
Submissions are welcome, please read: http://httpd.apache.org/dev/patches.html
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
And HEAD also has an optimised ssl_var_lookup.  Exposing the SSL * would
actually be tricky to do correctly (except maybe by exposing it as a void *). 
Going back to WONTFIX unless patches are forthcoming :)
creator: jorton@redhat.com
